title: 5W-KILO
author: 5W-KILO
content: It's been a long time that I knew about cloud storage and decentralised storage networks but I have never for once thing that this use case will survive in crypto space because I don't see any reason for adoption. Now I guess I am wrong ..File coin and Arweave are good example but I have a question in mind, anyone on here using this platforms for storing files? I'm still shocked they survive and doing fine.

Proof of capacity has become one big thing in the market and there have been projects known for being focused on storage but they're not in the cloud.And with those projects you've mentioned that are focused on cloud storage, I think there's a place for them and it's just a matter of time until most people would be looking into it. But the thing about the market is, it's all about investing and whichever becomes the most profitable, then people will be quick to go there.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Yaps, I have an honest review as well same as you.While the main feature they're offering (Cloud storage) not really gonna to be impact on "Cryptocurrency". However, from my perspective they're successful on marketing-startegy. Getting ICO on Coinlist (At the time, the platform who always sold out for every ICO).Also, they can entering main big exchange (Binance & Coimbase). So, from my perspective they are success on marketing.

comments.author: 5W-KILO
comments.body: What do you think of CRU? Crust Network? It's a new data storage project like Arweave and File coin but not so many are talking about this project right now and the value looks good enough for me, or do you have any better one?

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: 5W-KILO on January 30, 2023, 06:02:06 AM~A cryptocurrency that has storage-oriented utility will have a hard time if they did not make its usage as simple as possible for the mainstream. Another way to utilize their potency is to collaborate or integrate with any platform that connects their requirements with the storage-based cryptocurrency.For example, most of the platforms need to compete directly with Google Drive, Dropbox, or Mega. So in order to thrive, they need to have a smooth UI/UX for the users. Or, say their platform is used to incorporate other systems, like IPFS. One thing that I take a look closely beside the coins that are already mentioned here is Sia. Siacoin has been existing for a long time, and they are still struggling to develop the platform to make the regular Joe use the platform.

Maybe they have a killer app coming and i haven't paid attention but i wouldn't hold my breath.

comments.author: bittick
comments.body: Quote from: 5W-KILO on January 30, 2023, 06:02:06 AMWhat do you think of CRU? Crust Network? It's a new data storage project like Arweave and File coin but not so many are talking about this project right now and the value looks good enough for me, or do you have any better one? it doesn't look promising at all.
